text: The food was great and very fast and friendly service. I ordered the 5 taquitos and a salad. The taquitos had lots of chicken. Great taste.

I visit this place often and I can only recall one time that we waited almost 30 minutes for our food but I believe they were short staffed thats the reason for my 4 stars instead of 5.
Everything ive tried from the quesadillas, tacos, nachos, shrimp cocktail is consistent and reasonably priced. The Salsa bar is always well kept, its clean and the salsas are Good.. Not watered down like Robertos usually does. Overall I would say its great!

Alright so this place has bomb reviews, and it ain't for no reason! I came in last night at 5 minutes to closing (totally didn't check the hours) and was not rushed in the slightest. I order a shredded beef wet burrito, and it was seriously like 8 inches by 4 inches, at least!!! Big burrito, that's great, but not unless it's also on point in flavor - it was! I moved to vegas about a year ago, and have been searching for adequate Mexican food, and never really found it until now. The meat was juicy, and they put other stuff in, like beans, rice, guacamole and pico, probably some other yumminess, but I can't remember. I devoured it, in two settings, which resulted in two equally large food comas! Yum yum yum!! No picture but it looked as good as it tasted.
Great carnitaa burrito!!! If you like pulled pork you will love this...pick your own salsa to complment it!  I love the green !

No complains here. This place is not a gormet restaurant (nor does it act like it is), but it delivers when it comes to value and quality. The food is prepared fresh, and the portions are huge. The meals are also VERY affordable. Same sort of menu as Robertos Taco Shack, but much better food.
This place is nice, quiet, and very clean. The staff is friendly and the food is delicious. They also play kid friendly movies while you dine  we'll definitely be returning.

Vegas was beginning to dissapoint me until I came here.  finally found some good Mexican food! Family owned. Chips and salsa while you wait for your food. And the salsa bar is awesome. Won't be disappointed.

The place is Loca, Loca beuno. I think that means crazy good in Mexican dialect. Picked up three piping hot and delicious breakfast burritos for under $10.  Ate one and half of chorizo and bacon with egg, cheese, hash browns.  It cured my hangover but now I'm very full and sleepy.  The salsas are .  All of them. Stock up and slather your burrito and such. Gonna go into fat and happy chorizo coma now, bye.
Their little carne asada and carnitas tacos are the best around and if you come in during "happy hour" they're only a buck a piece. Salsa bar is on point also!

IDENTITY FRAUD??? We ate there last night and after we got home, there was an email from them asking us to rate their service! We never gave an email address. The only way they could get contact info was from the credit card we used. This is VERY DISTURBING and possibly illegal.

Ridiculous. This place is really just absurd. If you like spending money on overpriced, skimpy, bland meals, go somewhere else.
If you like food and like not being broke:
Bingo. Stop looking anywhere else. Don't bother reading any other reviews.
Eat here.
Then sit in Starbucks across the lot while you digest for a few hours. That's what I had to do after I destroyed a chimichanga. 
You'll be that full for under $10. And it won't taste like cardboard and spice.
Now I may be a white boy, but I love me some legit Mexican food. This is the place for gringos or otherwise.
Also, I sat around for a while after finishing eating to watch Jurassic World. Yeah, they play legit movies. Pretty cool addition.

The carne asada burrito,  carne asada nachos and carne asada big taco plate all verified DELICIOUS!  Delivery was super fast and all the food was fresh and hot. They also provided plenty of red and green sauce without request which was serendipitous since I forgot to ask for it. If you're trying to decide between this and another close mexican restaurant definitely go with this one.

Stopped by here to get their carnitas plato. It was excellent! I've already been back to have it again. I really liked it because the meat was moist and juicy. Usually when I get this plate, the carnitas is cooked to death. Not here. A while back I tried their chile verde plato. This is my favorite. However, the meat was a bit dry, so I won't be getting that again. If not for this dish, I would've given them 5 stars because everything on the carnitas plate was good, but the meat was the best. I liked their small homemade tortillas vs. those humungous ones that they give to you at other Mexican places. The service was good and I'll be back.

I ordered two burritos, a super nachos and a quesadilla for delivery and asked for 10 salsas. This place tried to charge an additional $2.50 for that. Enough said. Will never order from here again. Customers who walk in can get as much as they want and we only ask for what we use. They have a salsa bar! Just look at the pictures. 10 salsas for $30 in food is not excessive either. Stay far away from this place. Trying to ripoff people. What are they thinking? This is Vegas. Taco shops like this are a dime a dozen. 10 salsas? Really?

I hope they respond as to how that is an upcharge considering the size of the order and the fact they have a salsa bar for customers who don't order delivery.
Great carne asada and pork chile verde. Spent a little more than I wanted to but portions generous. Flan pretty good, cream-filled churro = yum! Will try them again.
Little family own restraunts. Very friendly . You can keep b up or dine in. My first time there thought I tried it out. Make sure you check in get your free 20 oz lol

This place is great! Fresh made tortilla chips, a huge variety of amazing salsa, great food and huge portions! Someone made a comment about the smell and it must have been a one time occurrence because when we went there was no smell and the place was very clean. Definitely 5 stars!

Well I've been wanting this place again since I tried them for the first time. I've been at work all day and my appetite meant business today. Walked in and it was empty and clean. I proceeded to place my order which was the special 4 pastor tacos with a soda and a red spicy carne asada wet burrito. I then went to the salsa bar which had every flavor for anyone's palate. There's also a guide to help you with the amount of spiciness. There is also convenient small paper bags so you can put your salsa cups in if you're ordering to go. What a great idea and you won't have salsa spilling everywhere after you get your food. I sat for about 10 minutes while I sipped on my soda and watched television. Great job on the customer service and brought my food to me and didn't call out a number even though I was the only one there. But on my first visit they also brought me my food even though they were a bit crowded that time. 

Now onto the food. As I've said before I can tell the pastor tacos maybe cooked on a grill instead of the big roll they slice it from. None the less the were okay kinda average. I'm from southern Cali and I literally grew up on mexican food. The meat was actually pretty descent and flavorful but just a tad bit greasy but then again I like grease though so I wont complain. I also opted to add onions & cilantro cause what's a carne asada taco without them right? I got both the hot green salsa and hot red salsa along with the salsa to dip my chips they provide you with.  The green hot salsa is not hot at all so that was a big disappointment. But that's my palate & love spicy foods & know it's supposed to have been hotter. However the red hot was ON POINT, flavorful, yummy, and indeed spicy. The 4 tacos were the small ones but they actually put alot of meat on them so they're definitely worth the price which isn't bad anyway and they give you a couple of those fresh homemade chips on the side.

As it stands now my belly is swollen & full so I probably won't get to that burrito till tomorrow because it's HUGEEEEE! I got carne asada, pico, rice, beans, and cheese on the inside and on the outside it's the red spicy sauce with melted cheese on top. I know by the looks of it that it's gonna be very delectable. 

Overall a very pleasant experience at a very clean establishment that has great customer service that made me feel welcome and appreciated my business. That alone will make me return again and again even though IN MY OPINION they could improve on the tacos but I'm still a very satisfied customer.

Yayyyyy! Thank you and your customers really appreciate that.

This was a hidden gem. We were going to go for our third visit to the place next door (Beijing Noodle) but decided why not try this small Mexican food place next door. Bottomline is great food at great prices. I got a carne asada  burrito for just under $5. Good, BUT the star of the show was that my friend got a the three enchiladas special for $6.25. A cheese, chicken, and a carne asada enchilada! Came with rice and beans. Beans are super excellent!
You need to try this place.
Hole in the wall Mexican place and it is very good for what it is. Some might think it's a little pricy but it is much better than tasting than your cheaper options. I'll be back

if i could give this place 10 stars i would...!

i work at a clinic up the street and my co-workers and i  
are always looking for some where inexpensive and good to get lunch from. 

first time i came in i ordered their carne asada fries...... yummm!!
compared to other places the fries where very affordable and delicious. i've been coming here since lol
i'm mexican my self and their food is very authentic.

 breakfast, lunch and dinner. from their chilaquiles, rolled tacos, burritos, tortas, tacos, wet burritos ( they are huge and smothered in a yummy sause), and carnitas plate. their agua de horchata and jamaica are soooo good!!!

i still have to try the rest of their menu which im for sure it will be as deliciouse as the rest of their food. 

there is honestly nothing to complaint 
about they are so friendly and humble here.
i really recommend this place.

This place was crazy good! I ordered the carne Asada sopes and the BF got the carne Asada tacos and they were both really good. The salsa was very tasty and they gave us free chips. The staff was very friendly. Looks like we found a new lunch spot!
I've tried better places...the food is not great but its edible. I live Rivas Mexican Grill on Desert Inn better for the same price.  I would not got back.
We have received delivery from them through Door Dash. The food is amazing here! We have found our go to place for good Mexican food!
Yum! Good quality! Low price!
The price is not cheap & food is ok nothing extraordinary! I ordered lengua burrito no sour cream & guacamole included n small chicken taco
Great authentic food, fair delivery time, courteous delivery person, and more food than we could eat!  Beef soup was homemade and to die for!  Definitely would recommend!!!!

No way to describe the food.... basically image Roberto's set up & it had a baby with Qdoba's/Chipotle's quality (I fucking love Qdoba/chipotle & can't think of anything bette than them... 
honestly this is a review for them to hopefully open more shops since it's a 1:1 mom & pops shop off of Flamingo & Tropicana locates in the Starbucks/Smog Shops parking lot.
All in all 10/10 I cannot express how fucking amazing the food is

Stopped in here today to get some lunch.

It's a small spot next to a noodle joint and a tattoo shop. 
The TV was blasting Judge Mathis when we walked in.
We ordered a fish taco combo, that comes with rice and beans.
Two small carnitas tacos, and a carnitas torta.

We got salsas, limes, and carrots before our food was delivered to us.
They have a vinegar salsa that was to die for!
Tacos were good, but I guess I'm used to the creamy sauce that comes with it...these fish tacos could have really used it. The small tacos were good, The torta was a tad salty for my liking.

The carrots were just mush. Usually, I'm used to them raw, with a little bit of crunch.These tasted like they were boiled before they were pickled. Not very appetizing.
Their combinations are great and come with lots of food. If you're getting that, be prepared to have leftovers. Otherwise, the burritos themselves are pretty good.
The Shrimp ceviche was good, the chicken enchiladas was a bit plain, did not have any taste at all. Carne Asada Taco was packed with meat, yum, and the carne asada fries were dull.
Legit mexican food. Tacos taste super fresh & great salsa Bar. Cevechi is different than usual with large shrimps. People are always friendly while taking my order.

THIS is the utter definition of a "Hole in the wall."  Nothing visually impressive, come to expect one thing upon entering... and getting something completely different.  Thank you, fellow yelp reviewers!  This place was great!

Everything in previous reviews is spot-on here.  Great prices - I had five rolled chicken tacos with lettuce, tomato, sour cream, guacamole, etc piled on $5.50 that included a drink.  So fresh!  So delicious!  So reasonable!  

Small space but clean - expansive menu with a guy/girl running the show.  Nice little salsa bar and they didn't try to kick me out when I arrived fifteen minutes to closing.  

I knew this was quality when he mentioned that they get a little slow around noon to two since "all the dentists and their assistants come to get food."  Dentists can afford to go to Lindo around the corner so we know this place delivers!  

I'm very sad this isn't closer to my house - I'd be there all the time.  Great deal and great food.  Ole!

Sooo good. Ordered through Grubhub for delivery. Order took 50 minutes to arrive and was hot and fresh. We had Carne Asada nachos, Carne Asada burrito, Taco plate. Asada fries. Rice and beans are good. Their carne asada is good quality meat . The Nachos and Asada fries come in very generous helpings.Will order again.

Ordered delivery it took awhile but it is worth the wait y'all. My boyfriend and I ordered the carne asada chips/fries and two tacos. I would suggest to eat the tacos there bc the tortilla became soggy but it was still good. The carne asada fries and chips were amazing. I haven't had good carne asada fries/chips since socal. This place is no disappointment. And their hot sauce if y'all like your food spicy go ahead and grab some it's so good and so spicy.

Solid, solid, solid 4.5 Stars for this place.

I've easily been here over a dozen times & they never disappoint.  I've had items from nearly every section of the menu.  The only things I haven't tried are the tortas.

This place is simply excellent.
Their food is really good, the churros are amazing, the horchata is awesome, the cashier was super nice, and it wasn't a bad price! I'll definitely be back.
Wet Burrito and asada fries everything was good the fries were kinda cold buy the time i ate them since i got delivery but other than that it was pretty good .

So clean ! Customer service EXCELLENT! Cashiers are always soooo pleasant & nice! I'm very picky on Chickn tacos but there's are good' always
Coming back

I can't wait to try everything on this menu.  We got smothered burritos that are massive and you have a choice of red mild or hot and green mild.  The red hot is great.  We had a colifornia and a regular carne adasa - the meat was tender and flavorful.  The only other thing we got was a fish taco to try it - it was also huge and so delicious - with a lot of fresh guac on top.  They have a huge selection and I really hope they do well - the food speaks for it's self.
Awesome Mexican food. Been coming here for a little over a month now and haven't had a bad thing yet. Carne asada nachos are the bomb.

While browsing through Grubhub I came across this place. The prices looked great and the food sounded yummy. Plus they had an awesome rating. Three of us in our office ordered food.
Upon placing our order the est. delivery time was about 1 hour. Very surprised when it arrived about 25 minutes later.
The food was hot and the order was correct. I was a bit worried since I had a carne asada burrito with no pico. The burrito was huge and very tasty. Everyone else who ordered also liked their food. (Vegetarian burrito, and a breakfast burrito). We will be ordering from here again.
This place is on my way home so I am looking forward to picking up some great food for dinner when I feel the craving.
We got a asada burrito and lengua burrito they were very good and huge. Only downside was the salsa it was super watery. If they change that is would be our go to Mexican restaurant

This was my family's go to Mexican restaurant. We would eat here several times a  month up until about 2-3 months ago.  The food doesn't  taste as well as before. Maybe a new cook but we can't even eat the food the last 2 visits we threw away more than we ate.

Nicest people you could ever spend your money with!  I am vegetarian so it has been a long exploration to find true Fresh-Mex that I could eat.  I called before I ordered and the awesome guy I spoke with gave me the rundown.  The tortilla chips, unfortunately NO, and the fried dishes, NO, (simply because the vegetable items are fried in the same oil as meat items,) but everything else was fantastic!!! Sooo fresh and delicious! And, they have eggs anyway you want ALL DAY and they sent every condiment and utensil I could possibly need.  That was a big plus. Salsa is terrific! !! I am so glad I found this place. Thanks Salsa Loca!  I have ordered and thrown away a LOT of food, but now I have a place I can stick with!

I went into Salsa Loca around 9pm.  The portions were too big! I could not finish it nor was it awesome that I could finish it.  It is a good value and they have a great Salsa bar.  They use Square for their ordering/credit card processing.  I am very impressed that a small business embraced modern technology.
Got sick from the food. Not flavorful at all, definitely won't be coming back. Just my experience when I went....wish it could have been different.

I went over last week. My boyfriend ordered the carne asada fries. I ordered the sopes. Everything was delicious. The place was very clean. The sauces are good. And the owner was very attentive and provided excellent customer service!! I would recommend this place to everyone in search of a real taste of Mexican food! :)
I came in with a valid Entertainment Book coupon, and they would not honor it.  Drove 30 minutes for this BS.  Beware.

Its very hard to find decent Mexican food in Las Vegas. I found Salsa Loca to be spot on with their tacos my favorite carnitas or al pastor the place is clean and employees very friendly. The salsa bar is enjoyable as well though I didn't think any of the salsa were extremely hot they were flavorful.

My go to for tacos. 

Came here cause it's right by a friends place. Great service, very clean inside. 

The tacos.....always made with awesome flavor. Prices of the street taco size here are only $1.65. For the price, I feel it's better than places that charge $2.50 a taco. I always get al pastor, carne asada, and sometimes lengua, and they never fail at satisfying my hunger for tacos. 

I wish they had tripas like tacos el gordo where it's super crispy but I'll come here any day over them if tripas isn't what I'm looking for. No lines, and fast service. 

Oh and they have caramel churros...probably shouldn't have it if you're trying to be healthy/physique (which I currently don't have) destroyer, so I'm not too worried.

I ordered a shredded chicken taco, a shredded beef taco, and carne asada nachos. The tacos were really good. Especially after adding some cheese and rice to them!! I must say, their carne asada nachos are AMAZING!! I recommend you try their food, if you haven't already!!
Fast, fresh, and inexpensive! Tried this for the first time and got their sopes special. Delicious!

We ordered their food through Amazon Restaurant Delivery! It was delicious food. I had the taco salad with grilled chicken and was very good. My 11 yr old son ate the grilled chicken quesadilla and said it was delicious! Very happy with our purchase.
In town buying a house, craving some good Mexican food. Let's just say I was definitely impressed and will totally go back. Ordered enchiladas and some churro's. Perfect

3-19-2016  I ran across this place the other day and tried their food.  I had the 3 Enchilada's with rice and beans.  It was good.  Several people had apparently phoned in orders  which is a sign the food is good.  There was a small salsa bar along the wall and the red salsa I tried was very good.  The place is small but the people were friendly and I left satisfied.  They advertised a plate of Chili Fries that looked good and I think I'll return and give them a try.   The place is located next to the Blue Ox which also has good food.4-20-2016 I tried the Chili Fries today....I wasn't impressed.  Fries were soggy and under cooked.

One of our favorite places, especially for Mexican food. We've been coming here pretty much since they opened- sometimes multiple times per week (sometimes my bf even comes multiple times per day). Great food. Really good prices. Pleasant staff

Ordered on Yelp so I dk what that actual place is like. However the food is bomb! I have tried it three times and have been happy every time. The carne asada fries are my favorite. They make sure to give u a ton of meat. Makes me happy! Lol
Best burrito I've had in my life or a realllly long time!! Wide selection of salsa and sauces, neat,  clean and friendly also very reasonably priced as well. Definitely returning!

In Vegas and wanted something better than paying $32-$49 a person for a meal. Stumbled on this place and the food was authentic. The customer service was genuine. Hand the 3 small tacos shredded beef, El pastor, and Pollo with bean & rice. Food taste of each item was right on point. The price of food was perfect, not high, not low. Would definitely recommend.
My go to place when I don't feel like cooking. The food is delicious always fresh and their salsa roja one of the best I've had

We ordered through Uber eats and we never thought the food was gonna be soooo good. The Birria tacos are the best that I've had in a long time. We will go there to eat them again now just made, they should be even more delicious ;)

Another easy 5 stars for Salsa Loca. The food here is delicious and abundant. I got the California burrito which was HUGE (see my pic) and the Mrs got the Carnitas Nachos which was equally impressive in size. Nice job!! Everything was really clean and not all gooey and greasy. The spicy red sauce slick topped my burrito was uniquely tomatoey in flavors. It was delicious however I felt it could have used a little extra heat factor. But that's okay because there are plenty of sauces that you can use to spice it up a little bit.

Pretty good Mexican joint! The grilled chicken nachos are to die for! The place is clean, service is quick, and there's also a board on the wall to let you know what each sauce is. (Major plus) I highly recommend this place! You can't go wrong here. The only down side is that they close at 8, but that shouldn't stop you from coming here.
Buena comida les recomiendo los burritos ricos y el caldo muy bueno y la atención muy buena definitivamente se las recomiendo

Found this place through Grub Hub. I am so happy with there food. Portions are large, the beans and rice taste as good home made. Every time I order I get chimichangas and carne asada burritos.  The chimichangas are my all time favorite. Crunchy deep fried tortilla smothered in cheese, sour cream and sauce. This is the only place I order Mexican food from after trying a few different places.
I don't know how to rate  the food because it took over an hour to get to me and was cold when it got here and they did not use a hot box. They should have also included utensils and napkins

I went around noon and the place seemed a little dark but I still was excited to try the food. The shrimp taco was ok, the asada tacos were better and the chicken soup was ok. Unfortunately, the rice was not fully cooked. That was the biggest downer of my meal. The salsas were great.

I ate two burritos here today haha. First, I tried the grilled chicken burrito and it was pretty good. Then I came back a few hours later and had the shredded chicken burrito for dinner and it was even better. Burritos are huge and packed with meat. You definitely get your money's worth unlike some other places. The salsas are pretty good, but I especially enjoyed the hot red and the vinegar salsas.

Authentic! Served fres, hot &  full of awesome flavors in you mouth!! My go to place !! Great customer service! Chips & salsa are amazing! Always order the carne asada fries or carne asada burrito which is huge! Hidden golden gem!

The food was fantastic. We ordered two hard shell tacos a la carte with shredded beef and two california burritos.

The tacos were big, not like most places when you order a taco and it shows up all teeny tiny. These were topped with shredded lettuce, cheese and sour cream. This is what I'm used to having and it hit the spot! I actually wish I had just ordered more tacos

The California burrito had asada, cheese and French fries! ?? I've never had a Mexican burrito with French fries.. And I'm also from CA so the name was odd to me. I assumed a CA burrito meant there would be lettuce and avocado or something. Anyways, I digress, the burrito was pretty good. The tortilla was super fresh and the ingredients just made sense. It was different for me and I like trying new things! I'm just happy I went with it.

Also, keep in mind we went 30 minutes before closing and on a Sunday. We were literally the only people in the place besides the ones who were running it. So my initial thought was-- umm, they are probably closing, it's a Sunday and they want to go home so our food might not be that fresh. I mean, I'm already trying something new and given the time and day, I was going into it mentally prepared that it might not be that good. Boy was I SO wrong. The tortilla chips with totally fresh, nice and hot in the bag.  We are looking forward to coming back!
This place was amazing! I got the 4 small carne asada tacos and my fiance got a chimichanga! It was so fresh and yummy! Would definitely recommend this place to anyone! :)

Tried it out through Postmates and was very happy. The carne asada burritos are huge. The chicken tacos were fresh. The horchata was better than most places and I believe all meals come with chips too. I would order again!
Big portions for cheap prices. I got a jumbo burrito with chicken, it was delicious, but a lot of rice and not much chicken. Good hot sauce.
This is an Authentic Mexican, family owned spot that delivers a warm, welcoming and personable, service and atmosphere -- with great food at a value price.

This place is truly amazing.  I come from California and find it really hard to find delicious but cheap mexican food out here but this place is where the treasure is. So far everything I have tried is absolutely delicious and I'm a very picky eater. I LOVE THIS PLACE

I live right down the street and am disappointed with myself because I just barely found this place like a month ago. I've yet to be disappointed by anything that I've had there. Their tamales are some of the best I've had in town and they do grilled chicken, not boiled, which is a bonus for me. My husband is way more adventurous then I am. He's tried damn near every protein that they offer and is always  raving about how awesome it is. Love this place, it's become apart of our weekly rotation.
Great tacos and fast delivery. Pleasantly surprised!! Will order form here again.

I looooove this place. I have never been disappointed coming here. This is literally the best Mexican food in town hands down. I cannot find any food that compares with theirs and they have great service! Also, the Carne asada fries and nachos are amazing. Highly recommend!

We ordered through UberEATS and the food was really hot and fresh when it arrived! We got a carne asada burrito, a chile verde burrito, a plate of chile verde and camarones a la diabla. Everything was really flavorful and nothing was overly sweet like we usually experience eating Mexican food in Las Vegas. The salsa for the chips that came with the burritos had a nice kick to it which was great.

I am a sucker for a good chile verde and I will usually judge a restaurant by the flavor of the sauce. This one was a gem. Bold tomatillo flavor and just enough spice. 

My husband also got a churro and he liked that as well. 

I'll post pictures next time, I inhaled the food too fast this time. Oops. 

We will definitely be ordering again. Best Mexican food in Las Vegas that we have tried so far and for a great price!

Salsa Loca is legit! Stopped in yesterday to grab lunch with the family and we've found our go to spot for quick order & eat Mexican food.

Salsa bar had a nice variety of different salsas, cucumber slices, limes and pickled jalapeños.

I had the California burrito which was big, flavorful and really hit the spot! So many places use garbage steak, or it's not marinated, and it's often overcooked. 

Salsa Loca used well marinated, flavorful and juicy carne asada that made for a great burrito that was big enough for a meal and not the dinky sized burritos so many places are trying to pawn off on hungry, unsuspecting customers.

The wifey got the sopes and really liked those as well. The carne asada tacos and side of rice got devoured by the boys who were asking for more and more!

Good service, friendly, smiling and took far better care of us than any of their competitors that we've been to. Definitely recommended!

I have ordered through them using UberEats and Yelp24. 

The food has been excellent, I would recommend the birria tacos and the rolled tacos. The worst thing I have to say is that sopes were only okay. Great quality and great pricing

My husband and i frequent this location. Pretty great overall. Always super yummy, service counter is easy and they are really quick. We usually take out and go home to eat, but we only live a few minutes away, but we've eaten in their dining room before. Love this place for the food and the service.

Typical Mexican food, huge portions, and decently priced. The salsa and chips are great. The combos here are good to choose from. My mom really liked the 2 tacos and sope combo, and I liked the torta with fries combo. Last time I came here I tried the asada burrito which was ok. Service was friendly and did offer dessert. Haven't tried any desserts since the food comes in large portions. 

I'll stick to the torta and fries combo.  Definitely will come back when I'm in the area.
I had the carne Asada burrito and the nachos Carne Asada for dinner. The food was average wasn't amazing nor was it horrible.

Great little place next to the Blue Ox on the corner of Flamingo & Sandhill.
We had the Chile Relleno plate, Carnitas plate & the Carne Asada Nachos.
All 3 of us were very happy with our choice. Food was well prepared and had good flavor.  Plates came with beans, rice, quac, pico and shredded lettuce.
You also got 4 tortillas corn or flour.  They have a great little salsa bar with mild to spicy.  Typical pickled jalapenos & carrots. We will come back here again to try some different menu items.
Total for the 3 of us with 2 drinks came to $17 after the $10 off restaurant.com
coupon.

The food was DELICIOUS!! Authentic Mexican food at affordable prices and delivery available through EAT24 (our office is in Henderson and they came all the way out here!) We had Carne Asada nachos, Chile Verde combo, and a Dos Sopes combo, everyone was completely satisfied with their meal and we will definitely be ordering from Sala Loca Mexican Grill again

Didn't get to eat!  Tried to use an Entertainment Book coupon but was told they won't take them. They said the Entertainment people never contacted them.  Somehow their logo and menu items were in the book. Oh well....
Love this place.. Best Mexican joint in town!! Everything is wonderful, check out he carne Asda nachos, shredded beef chimi, the birra tacos or the pesole.. It all rocks!
